page.title: 18Tarset Women's Institute
page.content: At 63 years old, Tarset has 30 members and in spite of competition from TV and other organisations, plays an important role in the life of the community. We had had talks/demonstrations on wine-making, eating for health and beauty, flower arranging, a film 'From Deadwater to Bellingham', car maintenance, cooking for a dinner party, the work of Hexham spinal unit and a foreigner's view of her homeland. In addition we have had a members' night which uncovered hitherto unsuspected talents! We have formed a darts team which plays regularly and during the winter we held keep fit and dance sessions in the village hall. Our president, Edna Waitt, a member of the Northumberland Combined Arts sub-committee, studied music at Denman College. Scty Helen Tait was at AGM at Albert Hall.
